body:
Here is the result -  I compiled with DEBUG=1 and then ran  "python test_cuda.py TestCuda.test_stft"
Result \:

ERROR: test_stft (__main__.TestCuda)

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "test_cuda.py", line 1004, in test_stft
    TestTorch._test_stft(self, lambda t: t.cuda())
  File "/home/freddie/builder/jenkins/pytorch/pytorch/test/test_torch.py", line 2704, in _test_stft
    _test((2, 5), 4, 2, pad_end=1)
  File "/home/freddie/builder/jenkins/pytorch/pytorch/test/test_torch.py", line 2697, in _test
    result = x.stft(frame_length, hop, fft_size, return_onesided, window, pad_end)
RuntimeError: Not enough padding values (1) supplied, expecting 2 (while checking arguments for cudnn_convolution)

----------------------------------------------------------------------
Ran 1 test in 0.541s

FAILED (errors=1)

Also I am using python3 from Anaconda if that makes any difference
